q: The traffic lights are green. Do you still have to consider the sign below?

q: Past the flashing amber light ______
optiona: ... you are not allowed to drive.
optionb: ... you are allowed to drive and you have priority.
optionc: ... you are allowed to drive and you have to apply the normal priority rules.

q: Who must stop ?
optionc: The brown and the blue car.

q: A driver of a car must not take into account the special traffic lights for the pedestrians.

Which driver is not allowed to cross the junction ?
optionc: From the car and the moped.

q: You approach a red traffic lights with your car. You stop in front of ______
Is the driver of the moped allowed to turn left?
This picture is taken from the car you drive in. What do you do ?
optiona: You are allowed to follow the grey car.

q: This picture is taken from the car you drive in.
optionb: You must, if necessary, give priority.

q: When should you stop ?
optionb: If the amber light is flashing.

q: When you see this traffic sign? you know that you ______
optionc: ... have to give priority and if necessary stop.

q: Who must give priority ?
Who has priority ?
What does this traffic sign mean ?

optionb: ... must give priority and stop if necessary

q: Are you allowed to overtake the red car at this junction?

optionb: ... must give priority and if necessary stop

q: This sign means ______

This traffic sign applies ______
optionb: ... until you see a sign: End priority zone.
